         <h1>
            <span id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_TitleHtmlPlaceholderControl" style="display:inline-block;">Buying and Selling</span>
        </h1>
       
        
       <!-- AddThis Button BEGIN -->
        <a class="addthis_button" href="http://www.addthis.com/bookmark.php?v=250&amp;username=xa-4b83364a75679c82"><img src="http://s7.addthis.com/static/btn/v2/lg-share-en.gif" width="125" height="16" alt="Bookmark and Share" align="right" style="border:0"/></a><script type="text/javascript" src="http://s7.addthis.com/js/250/addthis_widget.js#username=xa-4b83364a75679c82"></script>

            <div class="HtmlPhCBullets"
                <span id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_MainBodyHtmlPlaceholderControl" class="float_img_editor" style="display:inline-block;"><P>A vehicle can be sold with or without registration. Buyers of a registered vehicle must lodge an application to transfer the registration within 14 days of the sale. Your responsibilities when buying or selling a vehicle depend on whether the vehicle is registered or unregistered.<BR><BR>When buying from a vehicle dealer, the dealer&nbsp;is responsible for&nbsp;sending all required paperwork to VicRoads.<BR><BR><BR><FONT class=header_two size=4>Registered vehicles<BR></FONT>A registered vehicle must be sold with a <A title="Certificate of Roadworthiness (RWC)" href="/Home/Registration/BuySellTransferVehicles/CertificateOfRoadworthiness/default.htm">Certificate of Roadworthiness (RWC)</A>. You can still transfer registration up to 3 months after it expires. After this time the registration will be cancelled.<BR><BR><FONT class=header_four_green>Sellers responsibilities</FONT></P>
<UL>
<LI>provide the buyer with a&nbsp;Certificate of Roadworthiness that is no more than 30 days old when the sale takes place. 
<LI>fill in the seller part of the&nbsp;<A href="/NR/rdonlyres/1FA1DBE9-DEED-4BC9-9F5E-F115B54D7742/0/TransferOfReg_0713_WEB.pdf">Application for Transfer of&nbsp;Registration form&nbsp;[PDF 339KB, 5pp]</A>&nbsp; </LI></UL>
<TABLE style="WIDTH: 97%" class=pageIndex border=0 rules=all cellSpacing=2 cellPadding=0>
<TBODY>
<TR>
<TD>
<P><STRONG>Note:</STRONG> The seller is required to inform the buyer in writing whether the vehicle is entered on any&nbsp;<A href="/Home/Registration/WhatHasToBeRegistered/Written-off+Vehicles/WhatistheWrittenoffVehiclesRegisterWOVR.htm">Written-off Vehicle Register</A> either in Victoria or interstate. This can be done by ticking 'Yes' or 'No' in the appropriate section of the Transfer form.</P></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE><FONT class=header_three>
<P></FONT><FONT class=header_four_green>Buyers responsibilities </FONT></P>
<UL>
<LI>complete the buyer part of the <A href="/NR/rdonlyres/1FA1DBE9-DEED-4BC9-9F5E-F115B54D7742/0/TransferOfReg_0713_WEB.pdf">Application for Transfer of&nbsp;Registration form&nbsp;[PDF 339KB, 5pp]&nbsp; </A>submit the form,&nbsp;Certificate of Roadworthiness, transfer fee and Motor Vehicle Duty (see <A title="Transfer and motor vehicle duty fees" href="/Home/Registration/FeesFormsAndFAQs/Fees/TransferandMotorVehicleDutyFees.htm">Transfer and motor vehicle duty&nbsp;fees</A>) to VicRoads within 14 days of the sale. <STRONG><BR></STRONG></LI></UL>
<UL>To submit your transfer application and Statutory Declaration (if required):<BR>
<LI>post it to: VicRoads, GPO Box 1644, Melbourne, VIC 3001 (cheque or money order) 
<LI>visit a VicRoads&nbsp;<A title="Go to VicRoads Office Locations and Contacts" href="/Home/HaveYourSay/ContactUs/OfficeLocationsAndHours.htm">Customer Service Centre</A> (cash, cheque, EFTPOS, Visa or MasterCard).</LI></UL>
<UL></UL>
<P><BR><FONT class=header_two size=4>Unregistered vehicles<BR></FONT>An unregistered vehicle can be sold without a&nbsp;Certificate of Roadworthiness. <BR><BR><FONT class=header_four_green>Sellers responsibilities</FONT></P>
<UL>
<LI>cancel vehicle registration, remove number plates and return them to VicRoads. Refunds on registration are available if you cancel registration before it expires and the registration was in&nbsp;your name.</LI></UL><FONT class=header_four_green>
<P>Buyers responsibilities</FONT></P>
<UL>
<LI>ask the seller for a receipt and keep this as proof of purchase and ownership&nbsp; 
<LI>get&nbsp;an&nbsp;<A title="Unregistered Vehicle Permit" href="/Home/Registration/PermitsModificationsAndDefects/UnregisteredVehiclePermit.htm">Unregistered Vehicle Permit</A> (if you want to drive the vehicle home) 
<LI>register the vehicle (if it will be used for driving on the roads), see: <A href="/Home/Registration/WhatHasToBeRegistered/HowToRegisterYourVehicle/LightVehicleRegistration.htm">light vehicle registration</A>.</LI></UL>
<P><BR><FONT class=header_two>Evidence of Identity<BR></FONT><FONT class=header_four_green>Individuals<BR></FONT>If you do not have a Victorian licence or learner permit, you must present full&nbsp;<A href="/Home/Registration/WhatHasToBeRegistered/EvidenceOfIdentityDocuments.htm">evidence of identity documents</A> with the <A href="/NR/rdonlyres/1FA1DBE9-DEED-4BC9-9F5E-F115B54D7742/0/TransferOfReg_0713_WEB.pdf">Application for Transfer of&nbsp;Registration form&nbsp;[PDF 339KB, 5pp]&nbsp;&nbsp;</A> at a VicRoads Customer Service Centre.<BR><BR><FONT class=header_four_green>Companies<BR></FONT>If you do not have a client number with VicRoads, you will need to present full&nbsp;<A href="/Home/Registration/WhatHasToBeRegistered/EvidenceOfIdentityDocuments.htm">evidence of identity documents</A> with the <A href="/NR/rdonlyres/1FA1DBE9-DEED-4BC9-9F5E-F115B54D7742/0/TransferOfReg_0713_WEB.pdf">Application for Transfer of&nbsp;Registration form&nbsp;[PDF 339KB, 5pp]&nbsp;&nbsp;</A>at a VicRoads Customer Service Centre.<BR><BR><BR><BR><FONT class=header_two>Check vehicle details before purchase</FONT><FONT size=4><BR></FONT>Learn more about a vehicle before you buy, such as if its been reported stolen, written-off or has money owing on it. You can do this by checking the <A href="http://www.ppsr.gov.au/Pages/ppsr.aspx">Personal Property Securities Regsiter (PPSR).<BR></A><BR><BR><BR><FONT class=header_two>Exemptions from registration transfer requirements </FONT></P>
<UL>
<LI>trailers under 4.5 tonnes gross vehicle mass are exempt from&nbsp;Certificate of Roadworthiness&nbsp;and from&nbsp;paying motor vehicle duty 
<LI>transfer between domestic partners (eg. a husband and wife) can be exempt from Certificate of Roadworthiness and from paying motor vehicle duty 
<LI>recreational motorcycles are exempt from Certificate of Roadworthiness 
<LI>beneficiaries of <A href="/Home/Registration/BuySellTransferVehicles/Transfer/DeceasedEstate.htm">deceased estates </A>with will or without a will may be exempt from Certificate of Roadworthiness and/or paying transfer fees and/or&nbsp;paying motor vehicle duty.<FONT color=#1773b4><BR></FONT></LI></UL><FONT class=header_two size=4><BR></FONT></span>           
            </div>
               
         </div> 
</div>       
        
             
    </div>
